texts.definition: Game items that are use as resources for using weapons.
markups: <style="Definition">Game items that are use as resources for using weapons.</style>

Like in the real world, ranged weapons in many games require <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style>. This makes them a resources that needs to be conserved but may also provide possibilities to choose the ammunition types most suitable for specific situations.

The board game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Frag">Frag</link></style> has limited <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> for many of the more powerful weapons that players can receive through drawing from the aptly-named deck of "weapon cards".

Many combat-oriented computer games require players to keep track of ammunition, e.g. the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%20series">Half-Life</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Crysis%20series">Crysis series</link></style>. All games in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%20series">Fallout series</link></style> requires different types of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> for different types of <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>. In addition all games but <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%203">Fallout 3</link></style> provide several different types of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> of most types of weapons, e.g. hollow point and armor piercing, giving players opportunities to specialize their equipment for various combat situations.

As for computer games, roleplaying games where guns can play a significant role, e.g. GURPS and Mutant, have rules for many type of specialized Ammunition (for GURPS, a whole section of the sourcebook High-Tech is dedicated to Ammunition and warheads).

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Zombie%20Lane">Zombie Lane</link></style> uses <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> as a way of strictly regulating how many times a purchased weapon can be used before a new copy needs to be bought.

<style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> are <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> modulating <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>. Designing them consists of selecting first which <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style> need to use <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> and then how players can get hold of it.

While <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is a <style="Link"><link="resources">Resource</link></style> and can quite naturally be a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style> that need to be collected as <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> or from <style="Link"><link="loot">Loot</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="trading">Trading</link></style>, it does not need to be so. <style="Link"><link="resource-caps">Resource Caps</link></style> are a quite common modification that limits players possibilities to hoard <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> when it is plentiful, and thereby make it more of a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style>. However, <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> can be <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style> in another way - having to reload (which requires <style="Link"><link="downtime">Downtime</link></style>) makes the shots in one's magazine a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style> even if they are unlimited in the game. While depletion of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is typically the cause of using <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>, they can also be removed as <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style> as <style="Link"><link="energy-penalties">Energy Penalties</link></style>.

Several different types of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> can exist for one type of <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>, and is typically done to allow <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>. This can be simply as part of creating increased power levels as gameplay progresses so that <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Red%20Queen%20Dilemmas">Red Queen Dilemmas</link></style> can be maintained. It may however also be to let players selected between different types of <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>, e.g. ones that target specific <style="Link"><link="vulnerabilities">Vulnerabilities</link></style>. The <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style> may be balanced by <style="Link"><link="decreased-abilities">Decreased Abilities</link></style> to require players to do <style="Link"><link="trade-offs">Trade-Offs</link></style>. Varieties of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> may in some cases provide <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style> rather than <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved Abilities</link></style>, e.g. by being incendiary.

<style="Link"><link="regenerating-resources">Regenerating Resources</link></style> can be used on <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> but may only work for certain thematic types of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> if <style="Link"><link="thematic-consistency">Thematic Consistency</link></style> is to be maintained. An alternative to using <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> in a game is to instead use <style="Link"><link="cooldown">Cooldown</link></style> since these have similar effects on gameplay, and may be more thematically compatible with <style="Link"><link="regenerating-resources">Regenerating Resources</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> can be various diegetically present in games ranging from being fully abstract to being full-fledged <style="Link"><link="game-items">Game Items</link></style>. Having <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> as <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is a middle-ground choice.

<style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is a design choice for requiring <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> to use <style="Link"><link="weapons">Weapons</link></style>, and are typically <style="Link"><link="non-localized-resources">Non-Localized Resources</link></style> when attained. When they are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style>, or even when reloading <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> requires <style="Link"><link="downtime">Downtime</link></style>, the use of the <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> pattern promotes <style="Link"><link="tactical-planning">Tactical Planning</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="resource-management">Resource Management</link></style> often becomes an issue when <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style>. It can be either be a <style="Link"><link="facilitating-rewards">Facilitating</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="sustenance-rewards">Sustenance Reward</link></style> depending on the situation and overall game design.

When players have several different types of <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> to choose from for a particular type of weapon, this provides players with a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style>. When the access to more specialized <style="CurrentLink">Ammunition</style> is limited, this can in principle make the <style="Link"><link="abilities">Abilities</link></style> they provide into <style="Link"><link="temporary-abilities">Temporary Abilities</link></style>.
